issue.title: Features for better using pages opened with OpenCard action
issue.body:
Hello,
While working with fuxa, I encountered the following inconvenient:
On the main page I have several buttons which opens other pages (faceplate) using Open Card action. These pages have pretty much content. It'd be useful if the opened faceplate could be resized (including its content) by dragging from one of its corners. Another feature would be bring a faceplate on top of another faceplate by clicking it. 
As you can see in the below video, it'd be useful if I could resize the circle or line page. Also, would be great if, when clicking on circle page, I could get it on top of line page.
The practical scenario of these features is the need of being able to see on the same time the content of multiple pages.

https://github.com/frangoteam/FUXA/assets/58516894/0eec86cf-3a0e-4065-97a3-c2f44b72f0e4

issue.title: Number Formatting for Very Small Floating Point Numbers
issue.body:
Currently running Version 1.1.16-1325
Some floating point numbers with scientific notation in the region of e-6 and less fail to render on both the output box and table object.

Raw Data Via OPCua
![image](https://github.com/frangoteam/FUXA/assets/15365138/13de3848-179b-4d15-899c-1ceb361ff730)
Dialog View
![image](https://github.com/frangoteam/FUXA/assets/15365138/4a526b36-b01b-48da-a01e-070ec422550d)

Even with extended formatting 10 Digits for the Output box and 0.000000 for the table we either get Zero or NAN.

issue.title: Card View in mixed container can be changed via Event (Tag value)
issue.body:
### Discussed in https://github.com/frangoteam/FUXA/discussions/925
Originally posted by **fanhai** October 9, 2023 Specify a base page and a destination on the event opening page to update the specified subpages when using a mixed container First, divide the mixed container into several sub pages, each of which serves as a base page. You can place the base control page or drag and drop other pages to combine. If you drag and drop the switch button directly on this page, the Events of the button can specify the basic sub page.

issue.title: Dialog Close Script, or Hide Window close 'X'
issue.body:
### Discussed in https://github.com/frangoteam/FUXA/discussions/936
Originally posted by **robbudge** October 19, 2023 Any way to run a script on dialog close? or to disable the close 'x' in the top right. i use a common dialog and tag structure in the PLC for read only information, so when the use clicks on a device the PLC is sent an index to copy into the standard structure. Write tags we use the Variable bind. When the 'Close' button is clicked a value of 255 is written to the PLC inform the PLC the common structure is not required. This common structure can be upwards of 30 Variables Binding them would be a nightmare for 50 devices. The problem arrises when the user simply clicks the 'X' and the dialog closes. the PLC is still copying the data and the common area is utilized. a simple option would be make the 'X' White so still active just not visible, Any ideas ???

commits.message: fixed: value parser for FUXA server tags #938

issue.title: From the perspective of large-scale use, there are two things that need to be improved to make it more efficient.
issue.body:
1、In projects, pages that are similar to each other are often created, or multiple groups need to be repeated on the same page. At present, it is possible to achieve page cloning and group copy within the page. But it lacks the following functionality: batch search and replace for all element data sources.

2、The pictures on the page do not need to be placed in the database, but are loaded into the folder through links. Put it in the data, loading is too slow.

comment.body:
About the 1° comment, you can change the tags binding by use 'Edit bind of Tags' in context menu.
![image](https://github.com/frangoteam/FUXA/assets/48684550/dcd15186-13fb-4eb3-b7e9-a08971c5c99a)

or via 'View item list'
![image](https://github.com/frangoteam/FUXA/assets/48684550/0731eb59-9510-40de-9c27-99214e8310d2)

issue.title: In script: call $setTag to set Date string value can only show part of the string content
issue.body:
### Discussed in https://github.com/frangoteam/FUXA/discussions/924
Originally posted by **guolisongIsesol** October 7, 2023 Hi FUXA team, i want to record the exact alarm time and show it in an output control or table grid. So i write a script and first set the alarm time into a string variable and then call $setTag to set the alarm time to the output control or table grid. But the problem is that, the alarm time content like "2023-10-7 12:34:23:560", but the control or table grid can only show "2023". Can any one tell me how to solve this? Thanks in advance.

issue.title: createTag() / deleteTag() func
issue.body: it will give a vast improvment to fuxa scripts I think

comment.body:
There are several scenarios, These are (for me) the two main ones:

- Create variables in runtime enables the end user (machine operator) to create trend graphs af any variable, in the way there's a generic trend created during design time by the system integrator, and at run time, the end user decide what to watch in this trend. This is very useful when need to find the best value for a parameter, so you can create a trend with that parameter and its consecuences to the machine behavior.

- Imagine you have a modbus-TCP ligth stack tower and you want to use each channel of that tower as a free indicator of a certain event or var state. In many factories, usually you will find a lot of these ligths piled up and mixed (Babel towers I like to call them). With this feature, it is avoided, the operator can decide what vars to watch.

- It will improve the faceplate feature (listed in Fuxa help as "how to use the same view").

- In many cases when the amount of tags in a project is huge, or when I need millisecond timestamp of an event, the poll mechanism becomes slow. One way to avoid it is to watch what variables changed or what events rised at PLC side, creating a small ring buffer in the PLC, and then only the new items of that buffer are exchanged with the supervision system. I have made this mechanism using python in the past. You can see this case as a sort of communication driver for special cases.

There are many other cases, think that this is very usual to use this feature with commercial HMIs (Siemens, Weintek, Kinco, etc). But I know that this, (to create these funcs) is not a simple task, as there are several issues concerning, such as safety, set limits to avoid creation of tons of not desired vars if there's an error during creation, etc. 

Also, it implies the machine operator need to know the PLC address of each var he want to watch, what is not the usual. the solution is actually that is the maintenence personnel who uses to create the list of vars, and the production personnel who watch that list, in a trend or somenthing like. Also, in certain scadas like Zenon, these addresses are visible during runtime if you have enough access rights.

Thanks, and again, congrats for that beautiful piece of software.

issue.title: Touch Screen Login, Keyboard required or simple PIN with Num Pad
issue.body:
### Discussed in https://github.com/frangoteam/FUXA/discussions/931
Originally posted by **RobertBudgen** October 18, 2023 Is it possible to enable the onscreen keyboard for Login. Our system will be running on a touch screen in Kiosk Mode, no Physical keyboard or Windows keyboard is available.
